definition[0]: not noticing, or not taking the care to notice, other people’s feelings, and not realizing when they are upset or when something that you do will upset them
example[0]: One insensitive official insisted on seeing her husband’s death certificate.
example[2]: She’s totally insensitive to Jack’s feelings.
definition[1]: not paying attention to what is happening or to what people are saying, and therefore not changing your behaviour because of it
example[3]: Companies that are insensitive to global changes will lose sales.
example[4]: The service is insensitive to the needs of local people.
definition[2]: not affected by physical effects or changes
